intro: Croton sesseianus, commonly known as the Sessea Croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its diverse species with often milky sap. The plant typically features palmately lobed leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It is often found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
